name: Pineapple Fritters
author: William
summary: Something yummy and easy to make. My mom makes these every New Year's Day. These fritters are best served immediately.
ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) can crushed pineapple in juice, drained and juice reserved
2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar for dusting, or as needed  (Optional)
directions: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Whisk pineapple, flour, milk, and egg together to form a light and fluffy batter
Bring reserved pineapple juice to a boil in a small saucepan
Add white sugar and stir to dissolve; lower heat
Simmer until thickened glaze forms, about 10 minutes
Remove from heat and cool to room temperature, about 15 minutes
Drop spoonfuls of batter in the hot oil, 2 to 3 pieces at a time, and fry until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes
Drizzle glaze over fritters and dust with confectioners' sugar
